class pyuppaal.tracer.Tracer

Bases: object

Analyze the xtr file generated by verification from command line

static get_timed_trace(model_path: str, trace_path: str, hold: bool = False) → SimTrace

Get trace and its dclk interval of each transition state. To emphasize, due to the limitation of verification return of UPPAAL, the trace is no longer a specific time, but a constraints of gclk, which makes it easier to generate a verification monitor, but is poor at dividing parameters.

Parameters

  • model_path (str) – the path of model file

  • trace_path (str) – the path of trace file

  • hold (bool) – determine whether retain intermediate file, e.g., .if and .txt file

Returns

a SimTrace

pyuppaal.verifyta module

pyuppaal.verifyta.check_is_verifyta_path_empty(func)

A decorator used to check whether a path is set before running verifyta.

class pyuppaal.verifyta.Verifyta(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: object

Uppaal command line tools

property operating_system: str
property num_cpu: int
property verifyta_path: str
set_verifyta_path(verifyta_path: str)

Set verifyta path, and you will get tips if verifyta_path is invalid.

This function will check whether verifyta_path is valid by following steps:

  1. run ‘{verifyta_path} -h’ with cmd

  2. check whether ‘-h [ –help ]’ is in the result

Parameters

verifyta_path (str) – absolute path to verifyta

get__verifyta_path() → str
simple_verify(model_path: Union[str, List[str]], trace_path: Union[str, List[str]] = None, parallel: str = None, options=None) → List[str]

Simple verification with default options, return to the shortest diagnostic path.

Verify the model in model_path and save the verification results to trace_path.

Parameters

  • model_path (str | List[str]) – model paths to be verified.

  • trace_path (str | List[str]) – trace paths to be saved. Both .xtr and .xml formats are supported.

  • parallel (str) – <’process’|’threads’>, select parallel method for accelerate verification, None(default): run in sequence, ‘process’:use multiprocessing, ‘threads’: use multithreads.

cmd(cmd: str)

Run common command with cmd, you can easily ignore the verifyta path.

Returns

the running cmd and the command result

cmds_loop(cmds: List[str])

run in sequence

cmds_process(cmds: List[str], num_process: int = None)

Warning: multiprocess may be slower than single-process or multi-threads.

run a list of commands and return results.

if num_process is not given, it will run with num cpu cores.

if num_process is 1, it’s better run with self.cmd.

Returns

running cmds and associated result

cmds_threads(cmds: List[str], num_threads: int = None)

Run a list of commands and return results.

if num_threads is not given, it will run with num cpu cores * 2.

if num_threads is 1, it’s better run with self.cmd.

Returns

running cmds and associated result

compile_to_if(model_path: str)

Compile model_path(model.xml) to generate a intermediate format file (model.if).

Parameters

strmodel_path – Model path to be verified

Raises

  • FileNotFoundError – model_path not found.

  • ValueError – model_path is not a xml format file.
